Reviews.Title: NOISE is unacceptable compared to previous Nikon DSLR models.
Reviews.Author: Carlos O. Ruiz "BlenderPilot"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the D7000 to the D7100 because I wanted more pixels, but if you use JPEG the camera tries to to get rid of noise with processing (even at ISO100) and give you really soft images, if you use RAW you get more pixels allright, but you also get a LOT MORE NOISE, SO FOR ME, UPGRADING FROM THE D7000 HAS BEEN A HUGE WASTE, paid a lot for the same I would have gotten with a d7000.Then another problem, with ISO800 for instance, the D7000 did GREAT with Dynamic Range, but with the D7100 the dynamic range at ISO800 the Dynamic Range Drops to the same of a damn cellphone!!!I just got much better images with the 14MP of the D7000 than with the 24 of the D7100, in everthing else it's practically the same camera.
